instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
Device won't turn on when battery is plugged in .orange light is on when i plug in the charger the fans spin and then stop
current drawn 0.35a-0.45a

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
Please post as more information as needed.
Do you mean the machine turns on and runs correctly with charger alone (no battery)?

Check Q7030 and Q7055.
Post F7040 voltage w/ and w/ battery connected.

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
the fan spins and stops
Q7030 =
 pin5 =16.66 volt 
pin 1,2,3 =12.13 volt -  pin 4 =15 volt

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message: I have another 820-2850 motherboard - image was coming but there was squareness , i removed the video card, this motherboard does the same thing  the fan spins and stops.

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
"i removed the video card"
What this means?

The GPU is soldered on the MLB, there is no video card.
It can be disabled, as already posted on the forum.
Did you change C9560 before?

"Post F7040 voltage w/ and w/ battery connected."
If you've posted ONE voltage only, does this mean is the same in both cases???

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
step bay step 820-2915-B   fans spin and then stop 

battery installed

Q7030 =
pin5 =16.66 volt
pin 1,2,3 =12.13 volt - pin 4 =15 volt 

battery not installed

Q7030 =
pin5 =16.66 volt
pin 1,2,3 =12.13 volt - pin 4 =12,94 volt 

c9560 i didn't change  f7040 = 12,13 volt  same in both cases (battery not installed,battery installed )

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
I really don't understand why do you insist to post Q7030 all pins voltage.
I asked about ONE voltage point (F7040).
If you like to waste time, is your choice.

So you get incorrect PPBUS_G3H voltage, 12.13V; no matters battery is connected, or not.
That means bad communication between SMC and U7000.
Did you disconnect BIL?

Post voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
Did you disconnect BIL? what does this mean

SDA = 0.514
SCL =0. 515

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
J6955.

Can't you measure voltage on SCL/SDA lines???

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
you said measure the scl/sda line in diode mode, so I didn't measure voltage.

SDA = 3,474 Voltage and 3,0 voltage not fixed
SCL = 3,474 Voltage and 3,0 voltage not fixed

there are no sockets connected to the motherboard

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
"Post voltage and diode mode..."

With charger alone, the board turns on and restarts in few seconds?
Be aware, this board requires 85W charger to start (without battery).

SMC_RESET_L steady high?
Did you try SMC bypass ?

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
Sorry for the wrong and incomplete reading.
original 85 watt adapter yes
SMC_RESET_L  = 3.482 Voltage still

Did you try SMC bypass ? how can I do that

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
"how can I do that"
Didn't read "How To collection" thread yet?

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message: i tried SMC bypass  but the fan is not spinning and not power on, when i leave bypass , the fan keeps turning and stopping , it keeps doing the same thing it turns and stops

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
In SMC bypass should do same at least; just fan spins loudly.

SCL/SDA readings look good.
Try first changing U7000.
If still incorrect PPBUS_G3H, then need to change SMC.
Be sure first, R7000 is good.

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
hi,
u7000 change it
r7000 is good
F7040 = 12, 57 Voltage how many volts should there be ?  12.8 voltage Isn't it normal

fan spins and stops.

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
12.57V is very good.
Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
c7940 pin 1 = 3,3 volt sabit
q7802 pin 5 = 3,3 volt fixed

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
What "sabit" means?

I see you get PM_SUS_EN, but I asked about 3V3_SUS; Q7820 output...

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
sabit = fixed 
board view is wrong i guess, ,i dont understand
Q7820

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message:
Boardview file shows another package for Power FETs; not only for this board.
But voltage power rail corresponds with schematic.
What's not clear then???

If you are not clear with Q7820, then check PP3V3_SUS anywhere else.
If PM_SUS_EN is present, 3V3_SUS should be too; just need confirmation, to discard any Q7820 issue.

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message: 820-2915 boardview is missing a lot of net names. Use schematics to find pins and signals.

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message: I checked it on pin 1 of R1847 3.3 volts stable

threads.title: 820-2915-B Not power on
threads.message: Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for pulse at each big coil; at same time when trigger the signal.
